alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Magoffin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 26 at 11:12AM EDT until July 26 at 1:15PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHERN FLOYD, SOUTHEASTERN MAGOFFIN AND NORTHWESTERN PIKE COUNTIES... At 1112 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Prestonsburg, Coal Run Village, Martin, Forest Hills, Allen, Gulnare, McCombs, Betsy Layne, Justell, Boldman, Harold, Ivel, Endicott, Aluba, Heenan, Jarad, Alvin, Dana, Banner and Piso. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
